Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
**THERE IS PROFANITY USED IN THE NARRATIVE OF THIS REPORT**
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI250410439
Licensee Group Organization: Prism Project
Licensee Designee: Sylvia Blythe
Chief Administrator: Holly Halabicky
Agency Name: Mission Ranch
Agency Address: 9300 Lahring Road
Gaines, MI 48436
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 06/10/2025
Capacity: 6
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references
to a youth’s background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 used derogatory language when speaking about Youth A.
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 spoke about inappropriate topics in
front of youth.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 09/14/2023 and had no
additional information to provide.
Administrator 1 was interviewed over the phone on 09/15/2023
during an unannounced, face to face visit to the facility. She
stated similar allegations were brought to her by Youth A in recent
days, and in response Administrator 1 met with Staff 1 and wrote
up an “Employee Action Form” to provide coaching on building
relationships with the youth and having appropriate conversations
about and around them.
Youth A was interviewed over video conference on 09/20/2023.
Youth A stated she did not hear Staff 1 say anything disparaging
about herself, but that she heard it from Youth D. Youth A stated
her recollection of what occurred was Youth D and Staff 1 were in
the dining room and Youth D believed she heard a staff member
call a resident a “black bitch.” Youth A was not sure who that staff
member was. Youth A also stated that in that same interaction
there were staff and youth that had made the mistake of mixing up
her name and Staff 1’s name, which she stated was common
because they both started with the same letter. Youth A stated
Youth D told her Staff 1 then stated, “They keep calling me by that
black girl’s name, don’t you see how black that bitch is?” Youth A
stated she heard firsthand Staff 1 talking about Youth B, by saying
“That girl eats too much.” Youth A also stated there was another
time when she heard staff speaking about inappropriate things,
but she believed the staff did not know Youth A could hear them.
Youth A stated this occurred in a room that is attached to the
2

dining area. Youth A clarified this room is off limits to the youth,
and it is where documentation and medication is stored. There is
an open window between this room and the dining area where
youth receive their medication. Youth A could not recall specifics
of this conversation other than there were three female staff that
were talking about drinking, liquor, going out to bars and smoking
marijuana. Youth A believed these staff were Staff 1, Staff 2 and
Staff 3. Youth A also recalled a conversation directly with Staff 1
at an unknown time where Staff 1 told her she smokes marijuana.
Youth A stated the conversation was likely about times when
Youth A had smoked marijuana in the past herself. Youth A
believed Youth D heard this also. Youth A stated she, Youth B
and Youth D, reported these concerns to Administrator 1. Youth A
stated she also reported this information to Staff 4 and Staff 5.
Youth A stated Administrator 1 informed Youth A that it would be
looked into.
Staff 1 was interviewed over video conference on 09/20/2023.
Staff 1 recalled a time when she and some of the youth and other
staff were in the dining area and another staff member, Staff 6,
had accidentally called Staff 1 by Youth A’s name. Staff 1 denied
ever saying the words “black bitch” or anything else inappropriate
to that extent. She recalled joking back to Staff 6 about the
names being mixed up but that the race of any particular youth did
not come up. Staff 1 also denied ever “fat shaming” any youth or
making any comments about their weight in any form. Staff 1
stated she has never disclosed something personal like marijuana
use to any of the youth but has participated in conversations
where youth have stated that they had used substances in their
past. Staff 1 recalled one time where she, Staff 2 and Youth A
were talking, and this came up. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 had told
Youth A something to the effect of “once you are old enough you
can make your own choices” on things like alcohol and marijuana,
but that was the extent of hers or Staff 2’s comments about
substances to Youth A in that instance. Staff 1 stated the youth in
the program often discuss their pasts openly and risky behaviors
like the use of alcohol or marijuana comes up commonly. Staff 1
stated staff always try to redirect the conversation to something
more appropriate. Staff 1 denied a conversation about drinking or
going out to a bar with Staff 2 or Staff 3, and noted she has not
spent much time with co-workers out of work and couldn't recall
discussing any specific plans for spending time together. Staff 1
stated she was concerned and not sure how allegations like these
came up because she hasn't said anything close to them.
3

Youth B was interviewed over video conference on 09/20/2023.
She stated she was not present during a conversation involving
Staff 1 when Staff 1 called Youth B “fat” but did hear this from
another youth but could not recall details such as when this
occurred or who told her. Youth B stated there was another time
when she was on an outing with another youth that she could not
remember and Staff 1. Youth B stated she believed Staff 1 stated
to the other youth that Youth C “is overweight and that’s why she
can’t come to the horse farm.” Youth B also recalled the instance
when she and other youth were sitting at the dining room table
and Staff 6 accidentally referred to Staff 1 as Youth A. Youth B
believed Staff 1 stated in response “Do I look that black?” Youth
B stated Youth A, Youth C and Youth D were present but did not
recall if any other staff were. Youth B stated she personally heard
staff members in the staff office behind the dining area talk about
going out one evening as well. Youth B stated she was not in the
room with them and she did not think they knew she was present.
Youth B stated she heard the words “party” and “herbs” mentioned
but couldn’t recall any other specifics.
Youth C was interviewed over video conference on 09/21/2023.
She stated she heard Staff 1 get called by the wrong name before
on a few different occasions. Youth D believed there was a time
when Staff 1 had stated to Youth D, and possibly other youth
and/or staff, “Do you see how black that bitch is?” while in the
dining area of the residence. Youth D stated she kind of laughed
off the comment and that was the end of any conversation
between Staff 1, her, and anyone else present. Youth C also
recalled hearing a conversation between Staff 2 and other staff
that she could not recognize about going out and getting drunk.
Youth D stated she could not remember any more specifics than
that. Youth C believed she heard Staff 1 state one time that
“Youth B is always eating” and “You eat too much” to another
youth. Youth C couldn’t recall any other specifics of those
comments.
Staff 2 was interviewed over video conference on 09/21/2023.
Staff 2 recalled a conversation between she, Staff 1 and Staff 3
that occurred one time where Staff 1 and Staff 3 were making
plans to go out to a bar that evening after leaving work. Staff 2
stated this occurred in the staff only area beyond the dining area
of the building. Staff 2 recalled they asked her if she wanted to go
out with them and Staff 2 declined. Staff 2 stated there were no
other staff or youth in the room with them and she did not believe
there were any youth in the adjoining dining area because it was
late at night and the youth were in bed. Staff 2 stated this
4

conversation felt appropriate to her without youth present, and that
marijuana or specifics of kinds of liquor or “partying” was not
mentioned at all.
Staff 3 was interviewed over video conference on 09/21/2023.
She recalled a similar conversation to Staff 2 about making plans
to hang out outside of work with Staff 1 and Staff 2 one evening.
Staff 3 stated there was no mention of specific drinks or marijuana
or partying. Staff 3 stated she knows that youth can hear what
occurs in that room when they are in the dining area, or any other
adjoining areas of the house, because of the opening and the
general quietness of the whole building at nighttime.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 10/13/2023 over the phone. She
stated she has never heard staff say inappropriate things such as
commenting on youth’s weight or skin color or talking about
marijuana or drinking. Staff 4 stated she was not ever
approached by any youth about concerns like this.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 10/16/2023 over the phone. She
stated she heard from Youth A that there were some concerning
comments made about youth’s weight and skin color, but that
Youth A stated to Staff 5 that Youth A had only heard of this from
Youth D. Staff 5 stated she never talked to Youth D about this
and she has not heard anything remotely similar herself from any
staff members.
Staff 6 was interviewed on 10/16/2023 over the phone. Staff 6
recalled the specific instance where she accidentally called Staff 1
by Youth A’s name in front of some other youth. Staff 6 stated
that this occurred a month or so ago. Staff 6 recalled several of
the youth sitting down to eat dinner. Staff 6 stated she
accidentally called Staff 1 by the wrong name and Staff 1
responded with “Will you ever get our names right?” Staff 6 stated
she recalled Youth A being present because Staff 6 apologized to
Youth A at that moment. Staff 6 stated Staff 1 definitely did not
swear or refer to Youth A’s skin color in response. Staff 6 recalled
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D being present with her
and Staff 1. Staff 6 stated the interaction did not contain any
inappropriate language at all from staff or youth.
Documents reviewed:
• Training records for Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 were
reviewed:
o Staff 1 - Trust-Based Relational Interventions dated
06/30/2023.
5

o Staff 2 - Introduction to Unconscious Bias dated
08/30/2023 and Trust-Based Relational Interventions
dated 06/30/2023.
o Staff 3 - Introduction to Unconscious Bias dated
08/30/2023 and Trust-Based Relational Interventions
dated 05/31/2022.
• An “Employee Action Form” dated 09/12/2023 for Staff 1
was reviewed. This was the only documentation of
employee discipline in her file. This coaching provided to
Staff 1 regarded concerns that she had allegedly had
inappropriate communication with and comments about
youth in the program. On the form it is noted that Staff 1
either did not respond to the allegations presented to her or
denied them.
• An “Employee Action Form” dated 06/29/2023 for Staff 3
was reviewed. This was the only documentation of
employee discipline in her file. This coaching provided to
Staff 3 regarded proximity and supervision, documenting
and confidentiality.
• Email communication was received on 10/09/2023 from the
Executive Director of the program stating that Staff 1
resigned on 10/06/2023 effective immediately.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed there was not sufficient evidence found to show that
derogatory or inappropriate language was used by staff in
reference or directed at youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
10/19/2023
_________________________________________________
Tyler Armstrong Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 19, 2023_
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
